intro: Corydalis solida subsp. longicarpa, commonly known as the longpod lousewort, is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is native to regions of Asia, including China and Nepal. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, delicate flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in early spring. Its unique floral structure and medicinal properties have made it of interest in traditional herbal medicine. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated, slender pods, which set it apart from other Corydalis species.
